author: SteveL-MSFT
body:
which is a superset of ISO-8859-1 the previous default so that extended printable characters commonly used are available

addresses #3258

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @SteveL-MSFT Please see my comments in #3248 It seems the problem is deeper. Maybe we continue the discussion there?

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @iSazonov didn't see that discussion, let's continue this there.  thanks for pointing it out.

comments.author: mirichmo
comments.body: @SteveL-MSFT - Please nominate reviewer(s) for this PR

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: Based on most recent discussion, I believe we're not changing this.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
@SteveL-MSFT I believe we should close the PR w/o merge because of confusion. Defaults for Content cmdlets and Web cmdlets is different things. Issue for Content cmdlets is #3248 (blocked by CoreCLR). Default for Web Cmdlet I suggest better discuss in #3267.

But the PR seems contain useful improvement - load System.Text.Encoding.CodePages. I suggest make new PR for that.

title: changed default encoding to Windows-1252
